publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1211 Ted Brocklebank: St Andrew’s Society of Detroit—That the Parliament commends the work of the St Andrew’s Society of Detroit; notes that, since its founding in 1849, it has raised significant funds for charity, currently as much as $40,000 per annum to support worthy causes, including the Erskine Home in Glasgow; acknowledges that the society hosts the longest-running Highland Games in North America, and congratulates it on almost 160 years of celebrating Scotland’s heritage and culture and fostering ties between the old country and our cousins in the United States of America.

S3M-1211 St Andrew’s Society of Detroit (lodged on 23 January 2008) Jamie Hepburn*, David Stewart*, Murdo Fraser*, Elizabeth Smith*, John Lamont*, Nanette Milne*, Karen Whitefield*, Patricia Ferguson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Jim Tolson*, Trish Godman*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Aitken*, Jamie McGrigor*

S3M-1211 Ted Brocklebank: St Andrew’s Society of Detroit—That the Parliament commends the work of the St Andrew’s Society of Detroit; notes that, since its founding in 1849, it has raised significant funds for charity, currently as much as $40,000 per annum to support worthy causes, including the Erskine Home in Glasgow; acknowledges that the society hosts the longest-running Highland Games in North America, and congratulates it on almost 160 years of celebrating Scotland’s heritage and culture and fostering ties between the old country and our cousins in the United States of America. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, David Stewart, Murdo Fraser, Elizabeth Smith, John Lamont, Nanette Milne, Karen Whitefield, Patricia Ferguson, Roseanna Cunningham, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Brian Adam, Jim Tolson, Trish Godman, Alasdair Allan, Bill Aitken, Jamie McGrigor, Robin Harper*
S3M-1211 St Andrew’s Society of Detroit (lodged on 23 January 2008) Karen Gillon*
S3M-1211 St Andrew’s Society of Detroit (lodged on 23 January 2008) Gil Paterson*
S3M-1211 St Andrew’s Society of Detroit (lodged on 23 January 2008) Tom McCabe*
